title.native: ノー・ガンズ・ライフ 2

description:
Juuzo Inui’s next mission is to rescue Rosa McMahon, a girl who holds a valuable piece of data the Berühren Corporation is after. Still reeling from Colt’s death, Tetsurou swears to never hesitate again.

And somewhere in the city, Pepper is determined to make Juuzo her property along with her current Gun Slave Unit, Seven.

(Source: Funimation)

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Cyborg
tags.description: Prominently features a human character whose physiological functions are aided or enhanced by artificial means.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Noir
tags.description: Stylized as a cynical crime drama with low-key visuals.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Class Struggle
tags.description: Contains conflict born between the different social classes. Generally between an dominant elite and a suffering oppressed group.

node.description: [Twitter](https://twitter.com/karasuma2828)

Director who started off as an animator. Still animates on occasions.

Married to [Sayo Aoi](https://anilist.co/staff/118784/).

[Website](http://www.kenjikawai.com/index_e.html) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B7%9D%E4%BA%95%E6%86%B2%E6%AC%A1)

After dropping out of a nuclear engineering program at Tokai University, Kawai Kenji began studying music at Shobi Music Academy. However, he dropped out after half a year. With a few friends, he created the band Muse, playing fusion rock and participating in music competitions. Through competing in such contests, the band members became technically competent to enter the music industry and decided to part ways.

After leaving Muse, Kawai Kenji began composing music for commercials in his home studio. While recording music for [Yuji Mitsuya](https://anilist.co/staff/95874/) he met music director Naoko Asari, who advised him to compose anime soundtracks. Some of his most famous anime soundtracks can be found in [Patlabor](https://anilist.co/anime/1288/), [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/), [Ghost in the Shell](https://anilist.co/anime/43/), [Fate/Stay Night](https://anilist.co/anime/356/), [When They Cry](https://anilist.co/anime/934/) and more recently in [Mob Psycho 100](https://anilist.co/anime/21507/).

He has worked on several projects with the director [Mamoru Oshii](https://anilist.co/staff/99097/) and has written scores for all of Hideo Nakata's films. Kenji Kawai's music has received the Annie award and Hong Kong Film Award in 2005, for [Ghost in The Shell 2: Innocence](https://anilist.co/anime/468/) he was nominated for an Annie award.

Following his success as an anime music composer, he became involved in live action movies. He contributed music to horror films: Ring, Ring 2, Dark Water, Japanese-Polish science-fiction film Avalon and the Hong Kong film Seven Swords.

For the music found in Seven Swords and A Battle of Wits he was nominated for Best Original Film Score Awards at both the 25th and 26th Hong Kong Film Awards in 2006 and 2007.

(Source: AniDB)
Affiliated with [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tsuchiyawn)
Kimura Kashiko is an editor working for Mad Box.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/knzk_snow)
Affiliated with [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mykGhf)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yui_porikuwa)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/izmojuki)

Junji Okubo is a Japanese mecha designer working under the artist name IZMOJUKI.
www.izmojuki.com

[Website](http://www.sawanohiroyuki.com/) | [Website (nZk)](http://www.sh-nzk.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sawano_nZk) | [Instagram (Official)](https://www.instagram.com/hiroyukisawano.official/) | [Instagram (Personal)](https://www.instagram.com/sawano__hiroyuki/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/SawanoHiroyukiSMEJ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0Riv2KnFcLZA3JSVryRg4y?si=KaE_XDXqSRewfXXsxBNzoA) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/hiroyuki-sawano/156620523) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/1315147) 

Composer and musician represented by VV-ALKLINE since 2017. He was previously with Legendoor from 2006 to 2017. 
Sawano began practicing the piano at an early age, and studied composition, arrangement, orchestration, and piano under Nobuchika Tsuboi from the age of 17.

Active as a composer since 2004, he first gained recognition for his work on the Team Medical Dragon TV drama in 2006. He made his debut as an anime composer in 2006 on [Soul Link](https://anilist.co/anime/854/). In 2009, he released his first solo album *musica*, which included some of his more popular songs done for TV shows. In 2014, he launched a new vocal song project under the name "SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]", producing the first album *UnChild* with [Aimer](https://anilist.co/staff/107859/) as the vocalist under the name SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]:Aimer. Since then his songs under this vocal song project have also been used as the opening and ending themes for various anime.

He has cited [Joe Hisaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/100738/), [Youko Kanno](https://anilist.co/staff/95508/), [Hans Zimmer](https://anilist.co/staff/104669/) and Danny Elfman as major inspirations.

Non-anime role:

• **Xenoblade Chronicles X (music)** 
• **Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition (music)**

name.native: ジャン・ケン・ジョニー

node.description: Jean-Ken Johnny is a guitarist, vocalist and rapper in the Japanese rock band [MAN WITH A MISSION](https://anilist.co/staff/120063/).

__[Website](https://thisisjapan.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/this_is_japann)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/thisisjapann/)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/thisisjapann/)__

__Formed:__ 2011, Tokyo, Japan

__Introduction:__
THIS IS JAPAN is a Japanese four-piece rock band who formed at Sophia University in 2011. They originally started as a band who would make covers of songs from both the Western, and Japanese music scene. As a result of this, they have covered more than 120 different bands, with the number of songs being even higher. Later down the line, after all these covers, they would start writing and producing their own music, as well as appearing at live performances at the Shinjuku Motion.

__Biography:__
In July 2012, the band appeared at the viBirth x CINRA "exPoP !!!!! vol. 64". Later in September of the same year, the band released their first mini album titled "Japonika Gakushuu Souchi", a year later in October 2013, the band released their second mini album, titled "URUSEI BOKURA". After this release, their junior members Koyama and Mizumoto graduated the Sophia University. This is usually the point where people would quit their band to find employment, and proceed to generate income, career and a future, however, the band decided to keep going full-time and have been officially active as of this time.

On August 24, 2014, they released their first full-length album titled "THIS IS JAPAN TIMES", which distributed nationwide. Skipping two years forward, on August 3, 2016, they released their second album titled "DISTORTION", which was also released nationwide. Additionally, the band has performed between 40-50 concerts a year, while also performing at many festivals such as "CONNECT KABIKICHOU MUSIC FESTIVAL", "Shimokitazawa Sound Cruising", "Panafest !!" and "Tokyo Calling".

On Dcember 2017, the band performed their second one-man live show at the Shimokitazawa Shelter and shook the packed venue with a destructive live performance. Earlier in November of the same year, the band planned and produced an alternative compilation CD titled "NOT FORMAL-NEW ALTERNATIVE", which included 18 guest performing artists who had the potential to change the mainstream to something brand new. During the release of the compilation, a slighly rare occurrence happened, which entailed that the manufacturing inventory ran out of stock on the first day of release, which even further raised the interest in the compilation.

On May 2, 2018, they released another mini album titled "FROM ALTERNATIVE", which was the awakening piece meant to show the band's take on the genre Alternative Attitude, was completed. After this, while performing a one-man show and planning live, they would release a song on October 12 of the same year, which was also chosen as the theme song to the movie "LOUDER! Can't Hear What You're Singin', Wimp!". Their performance and arrangement on the song, titled "I'm burning", additionally won a competition. 

In 2019, they announced that they'd further refine their live performances, and since then they have become a staple group consistently performing at venues such as "BAYCAMP 2018 TGIF Eve Festival" and "Sound Cruising". This year, they have also appeared at the "FUJI ROCK FESTIVAL" on July 27, 2020, and at "BAYCAMP 2019" on September 15, 2020.

__Members:__
- [Jack Sugimori](https://anilist.co/staff/180182/Jack-Sugimori) (杉森ジャック) – vocalist, guitarist and composer
- [Yuuki Koyama](https://anilist.co/staff/180183/Yuuki-Koyama) (小山祐樹) – vocalist, guitarist and composer
- [Tarou Mizumoto](https://twitter.com/mizumotoman) (水元太郎) – bassist
- [Kawamura](https://anilist.co/staff/180184/Kawamura) (かわむら) – drummer, chords, composer and in-charge of lyrics

(Source: [THIS IS JAPAN's Official Website](https://thisisjapan.net/profile/), edited)

__[Website](https://thisisjapan.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/this_is_japann)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/thisisjapann/)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/thisisjapann/)__

__Formed:__ 2011, Tokyo, Japan
